sentences.english: You’re probably one of those weirdos that doesn’t drink coffee in the morning either.
sentences.chinese: 而且你可能也是那種早晨不用喝咖啡的古怪人。

sentences.english: This morning I went to the shop to change the coat I bought yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 今天早晨我去服裝店調換我昨天在那買的一件衣服。

sentences.english: I showed up at the campsite one morning to find them loading their carts.
sentences.chinese: 一天早晨，我在營地發現他們正往大篷車裏搬傢什。

sentences.english: In the morning sunshine, underwater world was beautiful vi-sion.
sentences.chinese: 在早晨陽光的照射下，海底世界美得如夢如幻。

sentences.english: What a treat for them - it's like having candy first thing in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 喫橡皮糖成爲他們早晨的第一件事。

sentences.english: The children should be allowed to go to the movies with friends on Friday nights.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們該當被容許星期五早晨和冤家們一同去看影戲。

sentences.english: He had to clean the chicken cotes every morning.
sentences.chinese: 他每天早晨得打掃雞棚。

sentences.english: I have a bowl of cereal every morning.
sentences.chinese: 我每天早晨喫一碗麥片粥。

sentences.english: It was a cool, misty morning when we woke near Uvinza.
sentences.chinese: 我們在烏溫扎附近醒來，這是一個涼爽有霧的早晨。

sentences.english: Another foggy morning in Chengdu –the weather of this season.
sentences.chinese: 又一個大霧的成都早晨，這個季節就是這種天氣。

sentences.english: That morning, Pilot Ayanami Rei ran to school.
sentences.chinese: 那天的早晨，駕駛員綾波麗是跑着去的學校。

sentences.english: I like to garden , do you like to sleep-in in the mornings or get up early ?
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡到花園，你喜歡睡在早晨或早起？

sentences.english: The fire broke out on the morning of Dec. 23, 1991.
sentences.chinese: 這次火災發生於1991年十二月二十三日的早晨。

sentences.english: In the morning, as you begin to awaken, you are in a semiconscious.
sentences.chinese: 早晨你剛醒來時是處於一種半意識的狀態中。

sentences.english: We shall be there at 9a. m and enjoy a full day there.
sentences.chinese: 我們要早晨9點到那裏在那裏玩一整天。

sentences.english: On Sunday morning we had singing lessons with Vishnu.
sentences.chinese: 星期天的早晨，我們上毗溼紐的歌唱課。

definition: in the evening/when night falls/towards evening/at night fall/at dusk
first thing in the morning/at daybreak
to get out of bed/to get up
at dawn/at first light/first thing in the morning
